title: Jourdan Dunn showcases her incredible abs in white crop top at an Adidas store launch in London
text:
She is one of the most popular models in the world.

And Jordan Dunn turned heads as she showcased her incredible abs at the launch of Adidas LDN, the new flagship store opening on Oxford Street, London on Thursday.

The catwalk Queen, 27, looked stunning in a white crop top and sleek trouser suit as she posed alongside Olympic diver Tom Daley, 25.

Flawless: Jordan Dunn posed with Tom Daley as she showcased her incredible abs at the launch of Adidas LDN, the new flagship store opening on Oxford Street, London on Thursday

Jourdan looked fierce and confident as she posed up a storm in the midriff-baring top by the sports brand, which she teamed with a smart blazer and tailored trousers.

The star, who is an ambassador for Adidas, added a pair of box-fresh white trainers to her look.

Her raven tresses were worn in a poker straight style, while she added a layer of glamorous make-up to her face.

Meanwhile, Tom, 25, cut a casual figure in a blue jumper, navy tracksuit bottoms and white trainers.

Laid back: Tom, 25, cut a casual figure in a blue jumper, navy tracksuit bottoms and white trainers

The diver was in good company at the event as a plethora of other sports stars were in attendance, including boxer Anthony Yarde and footballer Felipe Anderson.

While gymnasts Nile Wilson and Matt Whitlock were also enjoying the fun.

Footballers Millie Bright, Erin Cuthbert and Drew Spence flashed broad smiles as they posed for snaps.

Happy days: Footballers Millie Bright, Erin Cuthbert and Drew Spence flashed broad smiles as they posed for snaps

Sporty guys: Boxer Anthony Yarde and footballer Felipe Anderson were also in attendance

Chill time: Gymnasts Nile Wilson and Matt Whitlock were also enjoying the fun looked relaxed as the lounged on chairs

Sports pundit Ugo Monye also appeared in high spirits as he threw himself into the festivities.

The crowd were entertained by hop-hop group Run-D.M.C, who performed their biggest hits at the event.

Jordan's appearance comes just months after the the mother-of-one paid tribute to those who donate blood for her nine-year-old son Riley, who suffers from sickle cell anaemia.

Let me entertain you: The crowd were entertained by hop-hop group Run-D.M.C, who performed their biggest hits at the event

Music stars: The group had no doubt also performed their 1986 track, fittingly titled My Adidas

Cool: Ruben Loftus-Cheek celebrated the launch of the new store

The single parent shared an image of her little one in a hospital bed, Riley beamed as he received blood from a donor.

In her emotional post, Jourdan wrote: 'My heart is full of gratitude knowing that someone’s selfless act of donating blood is making my lil man feel better.

'To all blood donors out there I really wish I could thank you all personally for your kind act of donating blood to help my son and many others who are in need of blood. Thank you.'

Riley's inherited, noncontagious blood disorder leaves sufferers with a shorter life expectancy and periods of sickle cell crisis that last a few days and require serious medication and hospitalisation.

Eye-catching: Adrienne stunned in a red and black ensemble at the store opening

Living his best life: Sports pundit Ugo Monye also appeared in high spirits as he threw himself into the festivities
description: The catwalk Queen, 27, looked stunning in a white crop top as she posed with Tom Daley at the launch of Adidas LDN, the new flagship store opening on Oxford Street, London on Thursday.
